Anzac Day: Hawke’s Bay remembers with more than 30 services https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/anzac-day-hawkes-bay-remembers-with-more-than-30-services/57VGLRVUI5CC7FKSVPREBXUA6Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/anzac-day-hawkes-bay-remembers-with-more-than-30-services/57VGLRVUI5CC7FKSVPREBXUA6Y/ Doug LaingThe day starts with dawn parades and continues with civic and church services. Tractor incident: East Coast farm worker reports near miss in Safer Farms safety alert https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/tractor-incident-east-coast-farm-worker-reports-near-miss-in-safer-farms-safety-alert/HVKAWMK3X5CHJM7GIQPFUJK5JY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/tractor-incident-east-coast-farm-worker-reports-near-miss-in-safer-farms-safety-alert/HVKAWMK3X5CHJM7GIQPFUJK5JY/ The tractor's park gear failed and the unmanned vehicle started to roll towards him. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 04:00:00 +0000 Safer Farms safety alerts encourage farmers to share their experiences to minimise harm on-farm.
Pacific youth in Porirua: Learning through traditional cultural dance https://www.nzherald.co.nz/talanoa/pacific-youth-in-porirua-learning-through-traditional-culture-dance/ZPX34CDYVNGAJJHWQ3UT7TD7AA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/talanoa/pacific-youth-in-porirua-learning-through-traditional-culture-dance/ZPX34CDYVNGAJJHWQ3UT7TD7AA/ Grace Tinetali-Fiavaai, Te Rito Journalism cadetA number of Wellington schools are using cultural dance to help with their learning. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 04:00:00 +0000 Students from Porirua East's Windley School, one of the schools that participate in the (Haka in Schools) and (Poly Club In Schools) programme in Wellington.

Doctors’ strike: 2500 Te Whatu Ora Health New Zealand employees to strike after pay offer rejected https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/doctors-strike-2500-te-whatu-ora-health-new-zealand-employees-to-strike-after-pay-offer-rejected/SDD3YIPAPBC4HPQQFNYRDKS6ZY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/doctors-strike-2500-te-whatu-ora-health-new-zealand-employees-to-strike-after-pay-offer-rejected/SDD3YIPAPBC4HPQQFNYRDKS6ZY/ Raphael FranksUnion members rejected Te Whatu Ora's offers, voted to strike for 25 hours on May 7. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 03:49:54 +0000 Members of the New Zealand Resident Doctors Association (NZRDA) issued a strike notice covering 2500 of Te Whatu Ora’s doctors after bargaining with the health agency reached “an impasse”.

Auditor-General concerned about fast-track bill’s lack of transparency, protections for conflicts of interest https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/auditor-general-concerned-about-fast-track-bills-lack-of-transparency-protections-for-conflicts-of-interest/GMV7L4OI7RAWBKC7OYL6EKCZY4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/auditor-general-concerned-about-fast-track-bills-lack-of-transparency-protections-for-conflicts-of-interest/GMV7L4OI7RAWBKC7OYL6EKCZY4/ Thomas CoughlanThe Auditor-General says he's concerned at aspects of the coalition's new bill. Photo / RNZ, Angus Dreaver
